title: Mustang with 600,000 miles, a great read.

content: I bought this Mustang in 1967 for $2000 cash new. It got 24 MPG and would easily do 120 MPH. So what have they done to make a similar car worth $30,000 today?? NOTHING!! It's all a big rip off!! Same with homes and everything else! Wandering and Wondering
reply: I bought this Mustang in 1967 for $2000 cash new. It got 24 MPG and would easily do 120 MPH. So what have they done to make a similar car worth $30,000 today?? NOTHING!! It's all a big rip off!! Same with homes and everything else! Wandering and Wondering

content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: I bought this Mustang in 1967 for $2000 cash new. It got 24 MPG and would easily do 120 MPH. So what have they done to make a similar car worth $30,000 today?? NOTHING!! It's all a big rip off!! Same with homes and everything else! And what Detroit has lost sight of is that if they put out that exact car for that same price right now, they would not be able to build them fast enough to fill the world-wide demand... What a bunch of idiots!! Wandering and Wondering

content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: I bought this Mustang in 1967 for $2000 cash new. It got 24 MPG and would easily do 120 MPH. So what have they done to make a similar car worth $30,000 today?? NOTHING!! It's all a big rip off!! Same with homes and everything else! And what Detroit has lost sight of is that if they put out that exact car for that same price right now, they would not be able to build them fast enough to fill the world-wide demand... What a bunch of idiots!! Nice! Do you still have it???? Well, I do not think it would be legal to sell the exact car right now. Considering all the safety items designed into vehicles, more items standard (AC, pwr windows, pwr disc brakes, cloth seats, AM/FM/CD, tires, etc.) and overhead the car companies have, no way they could sell the car nowadays for $2,000. Adjusting just for inflation, it would have to sell for over $12,700. Add the overhead and so forth and a new 2010 V6 Mustang sells for around $21,000. Even at that price they are selling a lot of them. Does semm a little pricey, though.

content: I WISH!! Had to sell it to get the money for Mystical to follow me to Germany. When I came home 3 years later, saw some girl driving it - all covered with dings and rust - broke my heart!! quote: Well, I do not think it would be legal to sell the exact car right now. Considering all the safety items designed into vehicles, more items standard (AC, pwr windows, pwr disc brakes, cloth seats, AM/FM/CD, tires, etc.) But see?!?!? We're paying for a bunch of junk that slows the car down, makes it less efficient, wears it out, and doesn't help get us from point A to point Z - without freedom of choice!! That is absolute BS... Automobiles have become another form of slavery - - Wandering and Wondering
quote: Well, I do not think it would be legal to sell the exact car right now. Considering all the safety items designed into vehicles, more items standard (AC, pwr windows, pwr disc brakes, cloth seats, AM/FM/CD, tires, etc.)

But see?!?!? We're paying for a bunch of junk that slows the car down, makes it less efficient, wears it out, and doesn't help get us from point A to point Z - without freedom of choice!! That is absolute BS... Automobiles have become another form of slavery - - Wandering and Wondering

content: No, the slavery comes in the form of insurance and the supposed benevolence of the industry you are forced to do business with by the Government. LESS REGULATION FOR THIS NATION! Doesn't this somehow violate a conflict of interest for the Police officer? Maybe not? Also guy's, the safety requirements (remember the corvair) that are being put on cars are more expensive each year. We have more stuff to save the idiot than we do to slow him down. I got a 68 Mustang from my Dad when I came home. He wanted me to have a good car for my family. Wish I still had that car. Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?

I recently got in a car that had roll-up windows and thought 'how barbaric'. Yes, I have fallen for the creature comforts. And the V6 2010 is rated at the same 24 MPG you got. Someone let it go in three years?!?!?!? Blasphamy! Yeah, it would have killed me.....

content: The problem with the Amercan car makers is, they are cutting corners for the sake of profit. If they put effort toward quality American cars, they would rank at the top. Unfortunately greed has caused quality to slide. I will say, I had a 1986 Olds. Cutlass, it was the best car I ever had. In 1996 some idiot hit us head on, the car was totalled. I had a small cut on my forehead, no major injuries! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!

content: Cars don't rust anymore. Plastic doesn't rust. A lot of sad facts about the newer cars. Yes, it seems the engines are better. Means little in the survivability in a plastic car. Cop cars that explode on impact. I'ld rather have a Pinto.
